notesStmt.note: Darkening edges and a few text areas.
Ink offset to verso from rolling (possible damp).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 9; ruled lines: 24; written lines: 24; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking. No tagin on שעטנזגץ. The letter ח is frequently arched. Breaks in the form of open sections at 2:1, 3:1, 4:1, and at 5:1 in the form of a closed section. No majuscular nor minuscular letters. Larger initial word of the scroll.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script of the 15th to 16th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum from C.D. Ginsburg on 17 February 1891.
